title: Get Started
text: get REDCap turned R database… can set REDCap token three ways! need help setting tokens see article –> placeholder
code: library(REDCapSync) projects <- get_projects() # get list of cached projects View(projects) # show your previously saved projects project <- setup_project(   short_name = "TEST_repeating",   redcap_base = "https://redcap.miami.edu/", # change to your institutions link   dir_path = getwd(), # or change to your intended file path   # force = T, # use this to force a refresh   merge_form_name = "patient",   use_csv = FALSE, # if you don't have Microsoft change to TRUE   auto_check_token = TRUE ) #1. set each time in your session (not recommended in saved/shared scripts!) Sys.setenv(REDCapSync_TEST = "YoUrNevErShaReToken") #2. set to your private R sessions! usethis::edit_r_environ() #finds your file # Then you add --> REDCapSync_TEST = 'YoUrNevErShaReToken' # then save file and restart R # If it worked you will see your token when you run... Sys.getenv("REDCapSync_TEST") #And if your project object is setup properly... #3. Using the REDCap console project<-load_project("TEST") set_project_token(project) # can see if it's set correctly view_project_token(project)

title: Get Started
text: following functions represent core functions package.
code: project <- update_project(project) # update from redcap by checking log and using saved object  project <- add_forms_transformation_to_project(project,forms_tranformation = default_forms_transformation(project)) project <- transform_project(project) # transform to most basic forms, can be modified project <- drop_redcap_dir(project) #run shiny app! run_REDCapSync() # dev functions not ready for public yet project <- clean_project(project) project <- summarize_project(project) #can use for subsets! project <- summarize_project(project) project %>% save_summary() # will save summary data, look at the tabs!

title: Get Started
code: project$metadata %>% add_list_to_global() project$data %>% add_list_to_global() #project$summary %>% add_list_to_global() #not ready for public listviewer::jsonedit(project) # view object

title: Tokens
text: REDCap API tokens equivalent username password. never shared anyone. Ideally, never directly written R script, especially plan sharing future. Never commit file containing token git GitHub forever history. ever doubt mind quickly regenerate token REDCap website. working real REDCap project ’s good practice regenerate token periodically, week, just safe. Precisely tokens sensitive, REDCapSync designed reference name token, “REDCapSync_TEST”. REDCapSync ever wants use token make API call REDCap, check Sys.getenv("REDCapSync_TEST"). default token names start “REDCapSync_”, followed short_name chose setup_project().demonstrates set check tokens…

what: Setting Your Token for One Session
title: Tokens
text: can also set manually base R. Unless specifically set token Sys.getenv("REDCapSync_TEST") blank. Now token set R session . restarted R, blank .
code: library(REDCapSync) Sys.getenv("REDCapSync_TEST") #>[1] "" # Assuming you already setup or loaded a project object you can set the token like this... project <- load_project("TEST") set_project_token(project) # Set your token manually Sys.setenv(REDCapSync_TEST="a_FaKe_TOkEn") # again having this in a script is not advised but possible  # Get your token Sys.getenv("REDCapSync_TEST") #>[1] "a_FaKe_TOkEn"

what: Setting Your Token for Any Session
title: Tokens
text: may find want reuse token, may several projects, convenient way store tokens separate location. One way personal .Renviron file. , check always confirm location file make sure ’s part cloud storage git GitHub. can use usethis::edit_r_environ() semi-permanently save token. time launch R session file run token visible specifically called Sys.getenv("REDCapSync_TEST"). Open .Renviron file usethis::edit_r_environ() Add token like … REDCapSync_TEST = "faKeTokeN" Save file Close Restart R Session (Session tab .rs.restartR()). Confirm Sys.getenv("REDCapSync_TEST") reference token ever made saved REDCapSync name. example, REDCap project object token name project$token_name. future, may set token different way.
code: #Install usethis if you don't have it. #install.packages("usethis")  usethis::edit_r_environ() # Now save your token.... (without the comment symbol '#') # REDCapSync_TEST = "faKeTokeN" # Save the file and Close # Restart R Session (session tab) # .rs.restartR() # this will also restart R session for you. Sys.getenv("REDCapSync_TEST") # now should contain your token

title: REDCapSync
text: Several R packages exist using REDCap Application Program Interface (API) , REDCapR, redcapAPI, tidyREDCap. However, R package maintaining synchronized data pipelines REDCap. Enter REDCapSync, streamlines comprehensive extraction one multiples REDCap projects REDCapSync::sync().

title: REDCapSync
text: Using cache previous saves, file directory, REDCap log, {REDCapSync} updates data changed since last call. project becomes standardized nested R list object can used best R offer via statistics, visualization, shiny apps, ! REDCapSync unleashes full power REDCap API even basic R user. evolving aims REDCapSync … Wrap REDCap API functionality “behind--scenes” streamline use. Maintain local/cloud versions one many REDCap projects updating recently changed records user-defined schedule, daily, weekly, monthly. Automate standard tasks cleaning, deidentification quality control. Standardize creation custom data transformations subsets passed directory. Allow bulk imports uncoded data using R Excel/CSV. Power companion shiny app RosyREDCap leveraging combined strengths R REDCap, users can maintain strong data pipelines include statistics, visuals, even shiny applications!

what: Add Field Transformation to the Database — add_project_field
title: Add Field Transformation to the Database — add_project_field
text: Adds new field transformation REDCap database (project). allows users define custom transformations specific field form, including type, label, choices, associated function data manipulation.

title: Add Field Transformation to the Database — add_project_field
code: add_project_field(   project,   field_name,   form_name,   field_type,   field_type_R = NA,   field_label = NA,   select_choices_or_calculations = NA,   field_note = NA,   identifier = "",   units = NA,   data_func = NA )

title: Add Field Transformation to the Database — add_project_field
text: project validated project object containing REDCap project data settings. Generated using load_project setup_project field_name Character. name field transformation applied. form_name Character. name form containing field. field_type Character. type field REDCap (e.g., "text", "checkbox", "dropdown"). field_type_R Character. corresponding R data type field. Default NA. field_label Character. label field. Default NA. select_choices_or_calculations Character. string specifying choices (dropdown, radio, checkbox fields) calculations (calculated fields). Default NA. field_note Character. optional note comment field. Default NA. identifier Character. string indicating whether field identifier (e.g., "Y" yes). Default empty string (""). units Character. units measurement field, applicable. Default NA. data_func Function NA. optional function transform validate data field. Default NA.

title: Add Field Transformation to the Database — add_project_field
text: updated project object field transformation added.

title: Add Field Transformation to the Database — add_project_field
text: function facilitates addition new field transformation REDCap database. transformation includes metadata field's type, label, choices, along optional function process data. particularly useful customizing extending functionality existing REDCap forms fields.

what: Add a Subset to a REDCap Database — add_project_summary
title: Add a Subset to a REDCap Database — add_project_summary
text: Creates summary main REDCap database (project) based specific filter criteria saves specified directory. summary can customized additional forms, fields, deidentification options.

title: Add a Subset to a REDCap Database — add_project_summary
code: add_project_summary(   project,   summary_name,   transform = TRUE,   filter_field = NULL,   filter_choices = NULL,   filter_list = NULL,   filter_strict = TRUE,   field_names = NULL,   form_names = NULL,   no_duplicate_cols = FALSE,   exclude_identifiers = TRUE,   exclude_free_text = FALSE,   date_handling = "none",   upload_compatible = TRUE,   clean = TRUE,   drop_blanks = TRUE,   drop_missings = FALSE,   drop_others = NULL,   include_metadata = TRUE,   annotate_metadata = TRUE,   include_record_summary = TRUE,   include_users = TRUE,   include_log = TRUE,   with_links = TRUE,   separate = FALSE,   use_csv,   dir_other = file.path(project$dir_path, "output"),   file_name = paste0(project$short_name, "_", summary_name),   reset = FALSE )

title: Add a Subset to a REDCap Database — add_project_summary
text: project validated project object containing REDCap project data settings. Generated using load_project setup_project summary_name Character. name summary create. transform Logical. Whether transform data summary. Default TRUE. filter_field Character. name field database filter . filter_choices Vector. values filter_field used define summary. filter_list Vector. values filter_field used define summary. filter_strict Logical. TRUE, forms filtered criteria. FALSE, convert original filter id column filter forms record. Default TRUE. field_names Character vector. Names specific fields include summary. Default NULL, includes fields. form_names Character vector. Names forms include summary. Default NULL, includes forms. no_duplicate_cols logical flag (TRUE FALSE). TRUE, function avoid including duplicate columns output. Defaults FALSE. exclude_identifiers Logical. Whether exlude identifiers data summary. Default TRUE. exclude_free_text Logical excluding free text. Default FALSE. date_handling character string. One none,lowest-overall-zero, lowest-record-zero, shuffle-record-randomly, zero date date form 2012-12-05 upload_compatible Logical. TRUE, data compatible REDCap API upload. main conflict numeric date variables project missing codes clean = TRUE. R converts NA. Default TRUE. clean Logical. TRUE, data cleaned summarizing. Default TRUE. drop_blanks Logical. TRUE, records blank fields dropped. Default TRUE. drop_missings Logical. TRUE, convert missing codes NA. Default FALSE. drop_others Character vector values dropped. include_metadata Logical. TRUE, metadata included summary. Default TRUE. annotate_metadata Logical. TRUE, metadata annotated summary. Default TRUE. include_record_summary Logical. TRUE, record summary included generated summary. Default TRUE. include_users Logical. TRUE, user-related information included summary. Default TRUE. include_log Logical. TRUE, log changes included summary. Default TRUE. with_links Optional logical (TRUE/FALSE) including links Excel sheets. Default FALSE. separate Optional logical (TRUE/FALSE) separating form separate files opposed multi-tab Excel. Default FALSE. use_csv Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, uses CSV files data storage. Default FALSE. dir_other Character. directory summary file saved. Default output folder within database directory. file_name Character. base name file summary saved. Default <project$short_name>_<summary_name>. reset Logical. TRUE, overwrite existing summary files name. Default FALSE.

text: modified project object includes newly created summary. summary also saved file specified directory.

title: Set a REDCap API Token to Your Current R Session — set_project_token

title: Set a REDCap API Token to Your Current R Session — set_project_token
Set a REDCap API Token to Your Current R Session — set_project_token
text: project validated project object containing REDCap project data settings. Generated using load_project setup_project ask Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, asks user confirmation overwriting existing valid token. Default TRUE.

title: Set a REDCap API Token to Your Current R Session — set_project_token
text: Invisible. message printed confirm token successfully set.

title: Set a REDCap API Token to Your Current R Session — set_project_token
text: valid token already exists R session, function notifies user asks whether want replace . user guided provide new token console. strongly discouraged include API tokens directly within R scripts. token validated internally stored using Sys.setenv().

what: Setup or Load REDCapSync Project — setup_project
title: Setup or Load REDCapSync Project — setup_project
text: Setup Load project object pipeline.

title: Setup or Load REDCapSync Project — setup_project
code: setup_project(   short_name,   dir_path,   redcap_base,   token_name = paste0("REDCapSync_", short_name),   sync_frequency = "daily",   reset = FALSE,   get_type = "identified",   labelled = TRUE,   metadata_only = FALSE,   batch_size_download = 2000,   batch_size_upload = 500,   entire_log = FALSE,   days_of_log = 10,   get_files = FALSE,   get_file_repository = FALSE,   original_file_names = FALSE,   merge_form_name = "merged",   use_csv = FALSE,   silent = FALSE )  load_project(short_name)  load_test_project(short_name = "TEST_repeating", with_data = FALSE)

title: Setup or Load REDCapSync Project — setup_project
text: short_name character string spaces symbols representing unique short name REDCap project. dir_path Optional character string representing directory path want REDCap project data stored. missing, project object current R session. redcap_base character string representing base URL REDCap server. token_name optional character string setting token name. Default REDCapSync_<short_name> sync_frequency Frequency sync. Options "always", "hourly", 'daily', 'weekly', "monthly","never". check triggered calling function, can automated packages. Default daily reset Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, forces setup even project object already exists. Default FALSE. get_type optional character REDCap API call type. data user ran sync_project. Default FALSE. labelled Logical (TRUE/FALSE). whether use labelled vs raw coded data output. metadata_only Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, updates metadata. Default FALSE. batch_size_download Integer. Number records process batch. Default 2000. batch_size_upload Integer. Number records process batch. Default 500. entire_log Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, retrieves entire log. Default FALSE. days_of_log Integer. Number days checked log reset new project setup. Default 10. get_files Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, retrieves files REDCap. Default FALSE. get_file_repository Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, retrieves file repository REDCap. Default FALSE. original_file_names Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, uses original file names retrieved files. Default FALSE. merge_form_name character string representing name merged form. Default "merged". use_csv Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, uses CSV files data storage. Default FALSE. silent Logical (TRUE/FALSE). messages. with_data Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, loads test project object data included.

title: Setup or Load REDCapSync Project — setup_project
text: REDCapSync project list object.

title: Setup or Load REDCapSync Project — setup_project
text: function sets project object storing REDCap API token configurations required interacting REDCap server. ensures token valid ready use subsequent API calls. Neither function directly attempts communication REDCap. setup_project used first time initialize/link REDCap project. Mainly, sets unique short_name intended directory. Unless run reset = TRUE default first try load_project. dir_path technically optional without user save/load/update projects. load_project can used just short_name parameter already run setup_project past established directory. dir_path optional function can used relocated directory.

title: Setup or Load REDCapSync Project — setup_project
code: if (FALSE) { # Initialize the project object with the REDCap API token and URL project <- setup_project(   short_name = "TEST",   dir_path = "path/to/secure/file/storage",   redcap_base = "https://redcap.yourinstitution.edu/" ) project <- load_project("TEST") }

text: Syncronize REDCaps

title: Syncronize your REDCaps — sync
code: sync(use_console = TRUE, hard_reset = FALSE, project_names = NULL)

title: Syncronize your REDCaps — sync
text: use_console Whether use console guide sync vs just running hard_reset go get projects scratch TRUE. project_names character vector project short_names check sync. Default NULL check every project cache.

title: Syncronize REDCap Data — sync_project
text: Updates REDCap database (project object) fetching latest data REDCap server.

title: Syncronize REDCap Data — sync_project
code: sync_project(   project,   set_token_if_fails = TRUE,   reset = FALSE,   silent = FALSE,   ask_about_overwrites = TRUE,   summarize = TRUE,   save_to_dir = TRUE )

title: Syncronize REDCap Data — sync_project
text: project validated project object containing REDCap project data settings. Generated using load_project setup_project set_token_if_fails Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, prompts user set REDCap API token update fails. Default TRUE. reset Logical forces fresh update TRUE. Default FALSE. silent Logical (TRUE/FALSE). messages. ask_about_overwrites Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, prompts user overwriting existing data. Default TRUE. summarize Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, summarizes data directory. save_to_dir Logical (TRUE/FALSE). TRUE, saves updated data directory. Default TRUE.

title: Syncronize REDCap Data — sync_project
text: Messages confirmation.

title: Syncronize REDCap Data — sync_project
text: function updates REDCap database fetching latest data REDCap server. supports various options forcing fresh update, checking logs specified number days, retrieving files REDCap. function can also handle metadata-updates batch processing.

title: Test REDCap API Token linked to a project Object — test_project_token
text: Logical. Returns TRUE API token valid, otherwise FALSE.

title: Test REDCap API Token linked to a project Object — test_project_token
text: function tests whether API token stored project object valid making request REDCap server. token invalid, function can optionally open REDCap login page browser (launch_browser) /reset token (set_if_fails) using console.

TRUE, function prompt preview data uploaded proceeding. Defaults TRUE. view_old Logical. TRUE, function show preview old records upload. Defaults TRUE. n_row_view Numeric. number rows display previewing old data. Default 20.
